# Product Requirements Document (PRD)
## Project Name: Sheikh Shariar Nehal - Astro Portfolio

**Version:** 1.0.0
**Status:** In Development
**Author:** Sheikh Shariar Nehal (Generated by AI Assistant)
**Date:** 2026-02-03

---

## 1. Executive Summary
This project is a high-performance, responsive, and visually engaging personal portfolio website built with Astro. The primary goal is to showcase Sheikh Shariar Nehal's skills, projects, experience, and education to potential employers and clients. The site features a dynamic content management system powered by Supabase, allowing the owner to easily update their portfolio without modifying the codebase. The frontend is optimized for speed, SEO, and user experience, leveraging modern web technologies.

## 2. Goals & Objectives
*   **Showcase Professionalism:** Present a polished, high-quality representation of the developer's work and skills.
*   **Performance First:** Achieve high Lighthouse scores (90+) for Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices, and SEO.
*   **Dynamic Content Management:** Enable easy updates to portfolio items via a secure Admin Dashboard.
*   **Responsive Design:** Ensure flawless experience across all devices (Mobile, Tablet, Desktop).
*   **SEO Optimization:** Maximize visibility on search engines through proper metadata, semantic HTML, and structured data.

## 3. Technology Stack
*   **Frontend Framework:** [Astro](https://astro.build/) (v4.x)
*   **Language:** TypeScript
*   **Styling:** Vanilla CSS (Custom Properties, Flexbox/Grid, Responsive Media Queries)
*   **Database:** Supabase (PostgreSQL)
*   **Authentication:** Supabase Auth
*   **Animation & Effects:**
    *   `particles.js` (Background effects)
    *   `vanilla-tilt.js` (3D tilt effects on cards)
    *   `typed.js` (Typewriter effects)
    *   `scrollreveal` (Scroll animations)
*   **Icons:** FontAwesome (v5.x)
*   **Deployment:** Vercel / Netlify (Recommended)

## 4. User Personas
1.  **The Recruiter/Client (Visitor):**
    *   Wants to quickly assess skills and experience.
    *   Looks for project demos and source code.
    *   Needs easy contact methods.
2.  **The Admin (Portfolio Owner):**
    *   Needs a secure way to log in.
    *   Wants to add, edit, or delete projects, skills, and experience entries without touching code.

## 5. Functional Requirements

### 5.1 Public Interface
#### 5.1.1 Landing Page (Home)
*   **Hero Section:**
    *   Dynamic greeting with typewriter effect (`typed.js`).
    *   Interactive background (`particles.js`).
    *   Profile image with tilt effect.
    *   Social media links (LinkedIn, GitHub, Twitter, Telegram, Instagram).
    *   Call-to-Action (CTA) button to "About Me".
*   **About Section:**
    *   Brief bio.
    *   Personal details (Email, Location).
    *   "Download Resume" button.
*   **Skills Section:**
    *   Visual grid of technical skills (fetched from Supabase/JSON).
    *   Categorized display (Frontend, Backend, Tools).
*   **Education Section:**
    *   Display of academic qualifications (Degree, Institution, Years).
*   **Featured Projects:**
    *   Showcase top 10 projects.
    *   Cards with thumbnail, title, description, and links (View, Code).
*   **Experience Timeline:**
    *   Chronological display of work history.
    *   Alternating layout (Left/Right) for visual interest.
*   **Contact Section:**
    *   Functional contact form (Name, Email, Phone, Message, Subject - optional).
    *   Integration with email service or backend API.
    *   Contact image/illustration.

#### 5.1.2 Dedicated Pages
*   **/projects:** Grid view of all projects with filtering options (e.g., by category).
*   **/experience:** Detailed view of full work history.

### 5.2 Admin Dashboard (`/admin`)
#### 5.2.1 Authentication
*   Secure login page using Supabase Auth.
*   Redirect to login if accessing protected routes without session.

#### 5.2.2 Dashboard Overview
*   Summary statistics (Total Projects, Skills, Views).
*   Quick links to manage sections.

#### 5.2.3 Content Management (CRUD)
*   **Projects Management:** Add/Edit/Delete projects. Fields: Name, Description, Image, Live Link, Repo Link, Category, Tech Stack.
*   **Skills Management:** Add/Edit/Delete skills. Fields: Name, Icon Class, Proficiency Level.
*   **Experience Management:** Add/Edit/Delete work history. Fields: Company, Role, Start Date, End Date, Description.
*   **Education Management:** Add/Edit/Delete education entries.
*   **Image Uploads:** Drag-and-drop interface for uploading project thumbnails and assets.

## 6. Data Model (Supabase Schema)

### 6.1 `projects` Table
*   `id`: uuid (PK)
*   `name`: text
*   `desc`: text
*   `image`: text (URL/Path)
*   `category`: text (web, android, design)
*   `links`: jsonb ({ view: string, code: string })
*   `created_at`: timestamp

### 6.2 `experience` Table
*   `id`: uuid (PK)
*   `company`: text
*   `title`: text
*   `start_date`: date
*   `end_date`: date (nullable)
*   `description`: text
*   `created_at`: timestamp

### 6.3 `education` Table
*   `id`: uuid (PK)
*   `institution`: text
*   `degree`: text
*   `start_year`: text
*   `end_year`: text
*   `image`: text
*   `status`: text

### 6.4 `skills` Table
*   `id`: uuid (PK)
*   `name`: text
*   `icon`: text (FontAwesome class)
*   `category`: text

## 7. Non-Functional Requirements
*   **Performance:**
    *   Lazy loading for images (except Hero image).
    *   Minified CSS/JS assets.
    *   Core Web Vitals compliant.
*   **Accessibility (a11y):**
    *   Semantic HTML5 tags (`<main>`, `<section>`, `<nav>`).
    *   Proper ARIA labels for interactive elements.
    *   Alt text for all images.
    *   Keyboard navigability.
*   **SEO:**
    *   Dynamic meta tags (Title, Description, Open Graph) for each page.
    *   Sitemap generation (`@astrojs/sitemap`).
    *   Robots.txt configuration.
    *   Schema.org structured data (Person, WebSite).
*   **Security:**
    *   Protected Admin routes.
    *   Input validation on forms.
    *   Environment variables for API keys.

## 8. UI/UX Guidelines
*   **Color Palette:**
    *   Primary: Deep Blue / Purple gradients (as seen in CSS variables).
    *   Accent: Amber/Gold for highlights.
    *   Background: Light/Dark mode compatible structure (currently Light with Dark Admin).
*   **Typography:**
    *   Font Family: 'Poppins', 'Nunito', sans-serif (Public) / 'Inter', sans-serif (Admin).
*   **Interactions:**
    *   Hover effects on buttons and cards.
    *   Smooth scrolling navigation.
    *   Toast notifications for form submissions and admin actions.

## 9. Future Roadmap (v2.0)
*   **Blog Section:** MDX-based blog for technical writing.
*   **Dark Mode Toggle:** User-switchable theme for the public site.
*   **Analytics Dashboard:** Integrated view of visitor stats within the Admin panel.
*   **Testimonials:** Section for client/colleague reviews.
